title: B2 Cambridge Use of English - Multiple Choice

sentences.q: The residents are organising a protest _____ against the closing of their local hospital.
He never takes _____ in any college activities.
Our _____ was delayed owing to bad weather conditions.
Do you get extra pay when you work _____?
Whatever _____ him buy that old car?
All medicines should be kept out of _____ of children.
Everything in the sale has been _____ to half price.
I can never touch lobster because I'm _____ to shellfish.
The little boy _____ into tears when he thought he was lost.
All the food in that little café is _____.
Please inform the college secretary if you _____ your address.
Our telephone has been _____ for three weeks.
Label on bottle of medicine: It is dangerous to exceed the stated _____.
Stick this _____ on the parcel that says 'Fragile'. Then people will see that they must handle it carefully.
I've _____ for a job in Mexico. I hope I get it.
Look, Mother! James has brought you a _____ of flowers.
Although the town had changed in the ten years since he had last visited it, much of it was still _____ to him.
When his aunt died, he _____ a lot of money from her.
This year the company made a _____ but next year we hope to make a profit.
I'm afraid the lift is out of _____ so we'll have to walk up the stairs.
I _____ to inform you that we cannot exchange articles once they have left the shop.
I _____ hands with him when I was introduced to him.
His shoes were so old that his _____ were sticking out of them.
Would you _____ looking after the baby for me while I'm out?
I _____ you to drive carefully today. The roads are icy.
Can you hold the ladder _____ while I climb up and pick the apples?
We should have a good day's sailing. They _____ fine weather on the radio.
You can't go wrong if you _____ the instructions.
Why don't you look where you're going, James? You've just _____ on a snail!
'You know Mrs Jones, don't you?' 'I'm not sure. Which Mrs Jones are you _____ to?
They showed me some photos and I had to try to _____ the man that I saw coming out of the post office.
That girl's _____ a good squash-player.
My woollen sweater used to be bigger than this: it's _____ in the wash!
The small girl had to _____ three teeth taken out because they were so bad.
If you think you'll earn more money by working overtime here, you'll be _____ disappointed.
I could have _____ myself for making such a stupid remark.
The fire bell went off at work this afternoon. Thank goodness it was a false _____.
We _____ better not walk through that field. There's a sign saying 'Trespassers will be prosecuted'.
_____ March next year the club will have been in existence for 25 years.
The last _____ of tennis I played must have been ten years ago, so it's not surprising I'm tired out after this one.
I _____ what the weather's going to be like tomorrow.
He didn't recognise the woman until she turned round to _____ him.
I did everything I could to attract his _____ – shouted, whistled, waved my arms – but he still didn't see me.
She was _____ with friends at school because she always made them laugh.
The girl's teachers _____ her to improve her drawing.
_____ you do, children, please don't go too near the edge of the cliff.
She looks _____ she's been pulled through a hedge backwards!
He's been gazing out of the window _____ since it started to snow.
She _____ possibly be Tom's mother! She doesn't look old enough.
'I think we'd better bring Jim _____ this discussion', the manager said. 'He's got a lot of experience in this field.'
I shall always _____ not giving on a trip to Paris when I had the chance.
The old clown was a _____ sight, standing there with tears running down his cheeks.
That was a _____ of luck, wasn't it, finding that £5 note!
I wish you _____ to me before you went and bought that car.
There was a terrible traffic-jam at rush-hour because the traffic lights on the main road weren't _____.
I can't get that new book anywhere. Can I _____ yours for a day or two?
After signing his will, the old man placed it carefully in _____ envelope.
It was just beginning to get dark when we decided to _____ for home.
I am writing in response to your _____ for a petrol-pump attendant in yesterday's Daily Globe.
When he had examined her thoroughly, the doctor gave the woman a _____ for some tablets for her headaches.
The audience gave the soloist an enthusiastic _____ when she entered.
They've finally decided to _____ that lovely old house on the hill.
He was a novelist for many years until something happened which _____ him give it all up and go and work in a factory.
I'd like to buy the clock, but I haven't got any money on me at the moment. Could you _____ for me for a day or two?
I'd _____ you didn't touch that, if you don't mind.
The two men who were arrested for breaking into that shop have been _____ £500 each.
Mr Smith will be in _____ of arrangements for the end-of-term party.
I _____ of his course of action and told him to go ahead.
Emotional speeches often _____ strong feelings.
I took _____ of the opportunity to tell him what I thought.
He suffers from a speech _____ and so he cannot pronounce the letter 'r' properly.
He's the greatest _____ expert on French art.
He never attends _____ at the university so he may not know enough to get his degree.
The weather forecast said it would rain but it looks as if it's going to _____ fine.
He's fond of _____ his colleagues but he goes on working for the same firm.
The plane _____ at 7 o' clock.
My car _____ so I had to walk.
I was just _____ to go out when you telephoned.
You will become ill _____ you stop working so hard.
When he heard the terrible noise he asked me what was _____ on.
I don't think that red dress _____ her.
The three friends all _____ for the same job.
She remembered the correct address only _____ she had posted the letter.
It's difficult to pay one's bills when prices keep _____.
The dentist told him to open his mouth _____.
I learnt to _____ a bicycle when I was six years old.
Do as you think best. It doesn't _____ whether he agrees or not.
I don't think you've _____ Mrs. Walker before. I'll introduce you to her.
If the boss sees you doing that, you'll get into _____.
My husband's at _____. He'll speak to you when he comes home.
It's no good asking me to calculate the cost. I'm hopeless at _____.
The road was so _____ that the car bounced up and down.
You should be _____ of yourself for behaving so badly.
I _____ an answer to my letter in the next few days.
The car broke down but the _____ in the garage soon fixed it.
Why are you arresting me? I haven't done anything _____.
Roses are quite _____ flowers in English gardens.
Benjamin Franklin _____ the lightning conductor.
It was very difficult for the inspector to _____ what recommendations he should make.
This is not the right _____ to ask for my help; I am far too busy even to listen!
The job of student lodgings officer _____ a great many visits to landladies.
It is _____ knowledge in the village that Mr and Mrs Thorne quarrel violently several times a week.
All students leaving college at the end of term must leave their addresses so that letters can be sent _____.
Of course I'm a Christian _____ I expect everyone who works here to be a Christian too.
I think the birds must have eaten all the seeds I _____  last year!
Jim's _____ flu again! That's the third time this year!
They had so much snow there this year that when it finally _____, a lot of the area was flooded.
The driver might have _____ the accident if he had had his headlights on.
I have a vague _____ of going there once, but I don't remember too much about it.
They're both fairly easy-going with their children: strange, because they were both brought up very _____.
Please accept my _____ for not coming to the meeting last week.
I wouldn't _____ of going if I thought I wasn't welcome.
If I hadn't _____ so much for the shirt, I could have bought a tie as well.
The flowers were _____ more expensive than he thought they would be.
I wouldn't rush to be on time if I were you. John and Jean are _____ to be late as usual!
The storm did so much damage that over 500 people were made _____.
Anyone who _____ in an examination is a thief as he is stealing marks that he has not earned.
The class teacher punished disobedient pupils _____.
Always ask for a _____ when you pay out money.
Jim _____ Joe by calling him a thief but Joe only laughed at this.
She earns money _____ small children while their parents are at work.
It was a great _____ to study under such an outstanding teacher.
Although he never claimed to be _____ he attended church every Sunday.
It was a strange clock with an hour _____ that was longer than the minute one.
You may never again have such an interesting _____ of travelling abroad.
_____ people always want more than they've got already.
She is a quite _____ woman, fairly pretty, fairly intelligent, but in no way special.
He works as a teacher but in this position cannot _____ enough to provide for his very large family.
Do you think there is any hope _____ of getting help?
Although the examination he passed was not important, his success _____ him in his ambition to become a doctor.
Immediately the writer realised his notes had disappeared, he searched the room he was in _____.
I hope you don't _____ to my smoking.
When he lost his voice he could only _____ to his colleagues.
The apple was _____ that he put some sugar on it.
Do you _____ how upset she was when you said you couldn't go to her party?
Newspapers get letters on many and _____ matters of interest.
The medicine he takes can only _____ the pain; it cannot get rid of it completely.
The standard of our furniture is excellent but even so, we charge only _____ prices.
Every tooth in my upper _____ seemed to be aching.
Nowadays builders must get _____ from the Planning Authorities before putting up new houses.
He was so _____ to his family that he could not bear to hear them criticised by anyone.
I wouldn't do you any _____ to smoke less.
She always _____ a knot in her handkerchief to remind her of something she might forget.
We _____ not take our passports as we shan't be leaving the country.
Northern Europeans _____ to have fairer hair than people from further south.
Your basic salary will be £15,000 and _____ you'll receive generous travel expenses.
She works as an operator at the local telephone _____.
I am _____ to have a quiet week-end.
A British doctor writes a _____ for medicine which a chemist or dispenser makes up.
He's always asking if he can _____ my dictionary.
Do you think scientists will ever _____ all the mysteries of the universe?
The trade negotiations in Brussels have unfortunately broken _____.
The thousands who came to _____ the football match were disappointed when fog caused its cancellation.
Dr Sylvester will be making a _____ this evening.
Will you help me to _____ for tomorrow's exam?
I hesitate to consult a solicitor as I know his _____ will be high.
Can you give me a(n) _____ as to how I can improve my English?
The _____ age of the population of Ruritania is thirty-five.
He is studying to become a member of the medical _____.
He has turned _____ the offer of a job in Antarctica.
Her total _____, including the profits on her business, interest on investments and property rents, totalled £20,000.
After being friends for years, they _____ .
My mother has presented me with three _____ of home-made jam.
The loaf was covered with a golden-brown _____.
A newspaper _____ normally makes the final decision about the paper's contents.
Good _____! I hope you do well.
It is very difficult for the inspector to _____ what recommendations he should make.
This is not the right _____ to ask for my help: I am far too busy even to listen!
One of the _____ of country life is the difficulty of continuing one's education.
You're surely not suggesting that these _____ young children could have planned such an evil thing.
He _____ that he had ever been in prison.
One end of his single room was used as a kitchen but this was hidden behind a _____.
He was also _____ person who never smiled and who complained about everything.
The Committee has approved your qualifications and you will be _____ to the retiring Head Clerk's post.
Immediately the writer realised his notes had disappeared, he searched the room he was in _____.
I hope you don't _____ to my smoking.
When he lost his voice he could only _____ to his colleagues.
The apple was _____ that he put some sugar on it.
Do you _____ how upset she was when you said you couldn't go to her party?
Newspapers get letters on many and _____ matters of interest.
The medicine he takes can only _____ the pain; it cannot get rid of it completely.
The standard of our furniture is excellent but even so, we charge only _____ prices.
Every tooth in my upper _____ seemed to be aching.
Nowadays builders must get _____ from the Planning Authorities before putting up new houses.
